page.title: 08HEALTH CARE IN NEWTOWNARDS
page.content: Ards Hospital, originally a workhouse, caters for the Newtownards/Bangor area(89,000). It has 385 beds, 24 of which are childrens. The staff includes 47 doctors, 367 nurses and 350 other workers (clerks, domestic, etc.). Ten ambulances transport patients to its l4 Out Patients' Clinics while two are kept for emergencies. In Frederick Street close to the hospital is the Health Centre which houses general practices served by l5 doctors, l trainee, 32 District Nurses and l6 Health Visitors. At the Eastern Health and Social Services clinic at James Street a baby clinic, dental care, speech therapy, chiropody and eye testing is provided. The elderly have one old people's home, Loch Cuan House with 40 beds. Two social centres offer recreational activities for the elderly.
